events.text:
How do I escape this dump?
This world sucks!!! I should've never left the [color=#ff0000]Urn[/color].
My boss is gonna be SO mad because I fell into the wrong Vale.
...
You look like you aren't computing a word I say.
[color=#0f70ff]Vale of the Living[/color]? [color=#ff0000]Vale of the Dead[/color]? Buddy... do you even know where YOU are?

events.question: It's all around us. We've always been here. Especially the [color=#9effef]spiders[/color].

events.text:
I HATE the [color=#9effef]spiders[/color]! Acting all smart, spinning their webs of lies, skittering all over the place.
Or even worse: not moving at all like those ones you can see when you look above you.
Creeps me out, man. I'll never ever get used to them as long as I've been a Reaper.
I guess, they're nice though? I hate nice things, though.
That's why Maldoror and I here are such good pals.

I made a mistake. I shouldn't even really discuss this with a mortal.
I was off-duty before my fall.
I reap to eke out a deathly existence between [color=#0f70ff]your world[/color] and [color=#ff0000]mine[/color]... even if my Boss is a clown, I can't complain.
But don't get confused: I don't reap like a farmer works their land. It's the other, less honorable definition.
See, when you die in your world, you end up in a very chaotic, very busy place. 
The dead leave this world kicking, screaming, knowing little peace.
Therefore my fellow dead are predisposed to panic attacks, intrusive thoughts, upset stomachs,
melancholy - you name it - as they try to make sense of deathly existence upon arrival in the [color=#ff0000]Vale of the Dead[/color].
And that's where I come in.
I help move corpses and ash so that expired friends, families, and enemies can be reunited in death. 
I also moonlight as an arbiter for petty disputes between feuding Archdemons - my least favourite side hustle.
You ever see a scary orb of light above a grave? That's no ghost, that's Ajax [color=#ff0000]Floodlamp[/color].

Good. Who cares, right?
No point in saying much of anything these days.

Say no more! Say no more!
I like your style, buddy. Rude, few words to say, and an empty look on your face to match.
That's why Maldoror and I here are such good pals.

events.question: I guess that's why Maldoror likes you so much, too, huh?

events.text:
Well, Maldoror just showed up outta nowhere on your farm, didn't she?
Where'd you think she came from? The oddest cow around?
Please, let's just get out of here already. 
Check out these [color=#bbff00]rocks and caves[/color] and see if you can find a way out for us.

Ah, that's right! You're good, kid. You really are. I think we could've been frenemies in another world.
Anyway, check out these [color=#bbff00]rocks and caves[/color] and see if you can find a way out for us.
